reviews.review: It's pretty decent ngl.
why is it half

I experienced two subsequent bugs which effectively soft locked my run in the POWER UP stage. Before that the game was a fun, fast paced and atmospheric shooter with interesting level design and an engrossing story. The monster designs were unique and challenging to face. The shooting was visceral and fast; accompanied by a useful movement kit. The story was immersive and surprising; it caught me off guard several times. I heartily recommend the game until the POWER UP stage, and cannot comment past that.
probably worth spending money on it if you're in for a nostalgia trip. if you think that's it, there's couple of fan-made mods around the internet that you can install btw.

Doporučuji všem co se považují za opravdové hráče. Příběh je naprosto fenomenální, na tu dobu nadčasová hra s naprosto úžasnou grafikou a fyzikou.
Sice se tento první díl nedá srovnávat graficky s Half life 2 a rozhodně né s Half life Alyx ale i tak je to opravdu skvělá hra.
Popravdě jsem ji dohrál až po Half life 2 ale i tak jsem si ji toužil tak moc zahrát že jsem se do toho pustil a dohrál ji až do konce.
Doporučuji.

История о моём знакомстве о Халф Лайф.
Началось это всё д3рьм0 в 2018 года с того что я был пиратом и играл в КС 1.6 и я решил зайти в папку с кской и увидел Лямбду и название hl без раздумии я кликнул два раза и увидел Гордона Фримана и сразу ошибка я в этот момент:Б1ЯЯЯЯЯЯЯ!!!! Я после этого я пошел играть обратно в КС 1.6.  2020. Я начал смотреть ALLAN'а,Тазика,Фрилансера и я набрал смелости скачал Халф Лайф 2 ПИРАТСКУЮ! И я остановился на том что я удалил ХЛ2 и за этого бесконечной загрузки ГТА 4 и за неправильного определения видеопамяти (а видеопамяти было 1656 мб)
И я 31 июня забросил ХЛ2 и ХЛ1 но не забросил смотреть ALLAN'а Тазика Фрилансера (если что я забросил ХЛ2 на Рейвенхольме потому что СТРАШНО!) И сегодня ALLAN мне поставил сердечко под видео "Битва за Мировой Рекорд в Half-Life" Вроде все выговорил. А на этом все:D P.S Я забыл про своё мнение поэтому скачать начну писать,Игра классная затягивает но стой! Ты сейчас пойдешь писать что-то типо этого КАК ЭТО ИГРА ТЕБЯ ЗАТЯНУЛА ВРЕМЯ В ИГРЕ 0.2 да я согласен но я играл НА ТЕЛЕФОНЕ на Xash3d и вот так кстати игра меня затягивает и за классики,старой пиксельной графики и скажу вдохновление,любовь к ХЛ дал мне АЛЛАН вот теперь точно всё.
Playing a game that is 3 years older than me is crazy, but this game is a true classic that is still fun today, 21 years later!
Juegazo.Clasico

Should be played by everyone interested in video games, just for the historical aspect alone. Aside from that fact, it's a fantastic puzzle shooter that holds up shockingly well with age. This game is still worth way more than $10, so unless you can't afford a big mac combo buy it and play it.

There is a reason why this game rivals other first-person-shooter games of the 90's, such as Doom, Quake, and Duke Nukem, and that reason is the incredibly immersive storytelling; most other games will force exposition dumps upon the player - but not Half-Life! Instead of having to sit through boring exposition and dialogue you have no interest in, Half-Life tells a story with its incredibly immersive world, a world that few other games can rival. The game is one, long journey - no filler, no wasted time, no annoying interruptions, and certainly no times where you are forced to deal with situations in specific ways, which brings me to my next point: freedom; Half-Life is an extremely linear game, which completely contrasts what I just stated about it being linear, but that is where you are wrong! - the linear environments and level designs allow for a well-tailored experience that was built in a fashion that every single weapon (even the weak pistol) is useful. The sheer amount of weapons and options combined with the freedom the player has in using them lends itself to pure freedom for the player in combat, thus giving it some of the greatest combat, if not THE greatest combat, in any FPS game ever made! The game is perfection and has aged like a fine wine in both the game-play and story department, with the tiny exception of ladders (which are clunky nightmares), so I absolutely insist on anybody reading this to buy this game if they are interested!

I really liked it! I heard over the years that it was good, and I came into the game not expecting much since it was an old game; BUT I was surprised to find that I thoroughly enjoyed it to its fullest! The game has some really nice mechanics for an older kind of game. Music rocks, and the movement can be a little clunky, but its pretty great. Truly a masterpiece that withstood against the test of time.

Half-Life conta a história do Gordon Freeman, um cientista em mais um dia de trabalho nas instalações Black Mesa. Gordon é um dos encarregados de um certo experimento, mas durante o processo tudo dá errado e portais são abertos, trazendo criaturas do mundo Xen a Terra. O governo decide então enviar militares para matar tudo e todos, mas o Freeman irá tentar resolver a situação. Recomendo o jogo.

Simplesmente um dos melhores jogos de todos os tempos, influenciou e moldou o gênero tiro em primeira pessoa, junto com Doom, Quake, entre outros. Mesmo sendo de 1998, Half Life continua influenciando até hoje e apesar dos gráficos e outros fatores não serem muito modernos (mesmo sendo que na época era uma revolução), esse jogo ainda é muito divertido, definitivamente não envelheceu mal.

great game
this is kind of more of a review of half life 2 but like
for sort of the same reasons i like portal more than portal 2, i like this more than half life 2 and the episodes
its a simple concept, essentially just reach the lambda core to go into xen and survive along the way
half life 2 is overblown in a narrative sense, going around a whole city and saving the world
as a setting I like black mesa a lot more than city 17
also while i understand why all the npcs treat gordon like literal jesus in hl2 i think its much more interesting in half life, hes just a guy, the right man in the wrong place
its a lot more believable, hl2 is biblical in proportions
half life is also not gimmicky for the most part apart from on a rail which i do hate but given that thats one chapter out of the whole game that i outright dont like, i think its excusable
and while xen as a whole can get frustrating, i like the setting and i also dont think its that big of a deal as it doesnt feel as boring as literally all of hl2 up until you are in the citadel
in hl2 route kanal, water hazard, ravenholm, highway 17, sandtraps, nova prospekt, anticitizen one, and follow freeman (which is basically all of the fucking game) are all gimmicky as fuck, boring, and frustrating
half life is just better imo in every way
and while i dont hate half life 2, i will probably never play it again while i've played through half life several times already since first getting it a couple weeks ago
and while i do think the difference between portal and portal 2 is comparable to hl and hl2,
with the first being a concise, full exploration of its concepts, i think portal 2 expands on these concepts within the confines of the world set up in the first game in a believable and fun way
there was a lot more of aperture to see and more technology to test
but hl2 fails to expand in that same way because it leaves the setting of half life entirely.
portal 2 takes place sometimes literally in the exact same places as portal, and while i know in opposing force black mesa is destroyed, that doesn't make it not a problem that half life 2 and the episodes are in a completely new setting
in my opinion i dont really agree with the choice to make a sequel to half life
and being disappointed with hl2 makes me appreciate half life a lot more
its probably the best fps of all time
in the genre i dont think anything really compares
and its up there with my favorite games now
